example.eg: Crime is a common occurrence in big cities.
example.egtrans: 犯罪现象在大城市里很常见。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 常见的, 普遍的, 普遍的

example.eg: Our houses share a common fence.
example.egtrans: 我们两家共用一道栅栏。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 共用的, 共有的, 共有的

example.eg: There is no cure for the common cold.
example.egtrans: 不存在针对普通感冒的药。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 普通的, 常见的, 寻常的

example.eg: The government works for the common good.
Such common behaviour is to be expected of one with no education.
example.egtrans: 如此这般粗俗的言行举止只可能出自没有受过教育的人。

example.eg: That opinion is quite common in this part of the world.
example.egtrans: 在世界的这一地区，那个观点相当普遍。

example.eg: This cup is made from common plastic.
example.egtrans: 这个杯子是用普通塑料做的。

example.eg: It's just a common item, with nothing special about it.
example.egtrans: 这就是个普通货色，没什么特别的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 次等的, 低级的, 一般的

example.eg: The police treated me like a common criminal.
example.egtrans: 警察就像对臭名昭著的罪犯一样对待我。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 臭名昭著的, 臭名远扬的

dsense.name: common
dsense.guideword: (without rank) (没有职称、等级、排名等的)

example.eg: He is just a common worker - not the boss.
example.egtrans: 他只是一名普通工人，不是老板。

example.eg: We ate lunch on the common.
example.egtrans: 我们在公共草地吃了午餐。

example.eg: All villagers have common of fishing in these waters.
example.egtrans: 全体村民共同享有这些水域的捕鱼权。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 共有权，共同享有的权利

example.eg: The students ate in commons every night.
We have to be in the dining room at five o'clock for commons.
There are currently 650 MPs in the Commons.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 通过共识, 协议, 共识

example.eg: My friend and I always thought it was strange how we looked so alike until we discovered we shared a common ancestry.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 共同的祖先, 同根同源

example.eg: Apes and humans share a common ancestry.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有相同的祖先，有相同的先人

example.eg: It is a common belief that education will improve your employment prospects.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 普遍的观点, 大众观点

example.eg: It means a lot to both of us that, over the years, we continue to share many common beliefs.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 共同的思想, 共有的信念

example.eg: My common bond with him is that we grew up in the same neighborhood.
That company is a common carrier both in California and Nevada.
There's no cure for the common cold.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最基本的礼貌，最基本的礼节

example.eg: Though the sisters were different in almost every way, one common denominator was their love of horses.
A traditional political move is to unite the people by creating a common enemy.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 共同的敌人, 公共利益

example.eg: We started dating because we had a lot of common ground in our likes and dislikes.
It was common knowledge among the staff that Bill had a drinking problem.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 常识, 尽人皆知的事

example.eg: The common loon makes a mournful sound which echoes through the night.

dsense.name: the common man
dsense.guideword: dated, uncountable (ordinary citizen, lay person) (过时用语)

example.eg: The political parties are all trying to appeal to the common man.

dsense.name: common man
dsense.guideword: (male commoner, without title) (指无贵族头衔的男性)

example.eg: If a common man married the daughter of a nobleman, she would lose her title.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 普遍看法, 一般性意见

example.eg: The condominium owners have common ownership of the public areas.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 共同所有权, 共有权

example.eg: They don't stand out for any particular reason; they're just common people.
example.egtrans: 他们没有什么特别的地方，只是平头老百姓。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 普通人, 大众, 老百姓

example.eg: "God must have loved the common people, he made so many of them." -  Abraham Lincoln
example.egtrans: "上帝必定非常喜爱普通人，所以才造就了这么多普通人。" - 亚伯拉罕·林肯

trans_examp.trans_cn: 劳动人民, 蓝领阶级

example.eg: It takes awhile to learn the common phrases in a foreign language.
It is common practice to speak softly in a library.
When I use a common saying it's folk wisdom, and when you use it, it's called a cliché.
He's an educated man, but he doesn't have much common sense.
example.egtrans: 他是个受过教育的人，不过没有什么常识。

example.eg: Poorly built homes are a common source of law suits.  The Internet is now a common source of information.
example.egtrans: 豆腐渣建筑是主要的诉讼来源。因特网现在成为了主要的信息来源处。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 主要来源, 主要来源地

example.eg: All Indo-European languages are thought to come from a common source.
Breeding the common stock with purebreds improves the quality of the herd.
They're not in our class, dear. They come from common stock.

dsense.name: common stock
dsense.guideword: (finance: share) (一般与优先股相对的一种股票)

example.eg: The company issues two classes of equity: common stock and preferred stock.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 普通用语, 通俗说法
共同的主题，贯穿的主题，相似的模式

example.eg: We have reached a common understanding.
The common understanding of the word "silent" is no noise whatsoever.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不成文法的, 习惯法的

dsense.name: common-law marriage
dsense.guideword: (partnership: not formalized) (指非正式结婚但同居的关系)

example.eg: When a common-law marriage exists, the spouses receive the same legal treatment given to legally married couples.
example.egtrans: 如果造成事实婚姻，婚姻双方在法律上享受与合法婚姻伴侣相同的待遇。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 习惯法上的婚姻，事实婚姻

example.eg: John had more than one common-law wife, though he was never married.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 习惯法上的妻子, 事实婚姻中的妻子

example.eg: The rich have little in common with the poor.
At first glance she seems to have nothing in common with her boyfriend.
Luckily, they get on well as they have so many things in common.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有共同点, 有共通之处

example.eg: My best friend and I get on well because we have so many things in common.
example.egtrans: 我之所以和挚友相处得很好，是因为我们有很多共同点。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 共享地, 共有地, 共同地

dsense.name: least common denominator, lowest common denominator

example.eg: The least common denominator of the two fractions 1/6 and 1/4 is 12.
The movie was crude and superficial, appealing to the lowest common denominator.
The union made common cause with the government in an effort to keep the factory from leaving town.

dsense.name: marshmallow, marsh mallow, marsh-mallow, common marshmallow

example.eg: All parts of the marshmallow are used in herbal medicine.
example.egtrans: 药蜀葵的所有部分都可以入药。
